comments.commentBody: The attorney general lied under oath. He is unfit for service. The entire trump administration is illegitimate. The entire 2016 election was a fraud of massive system wide voter suppression that we have not seen since the "Good old days" when "America was great". Before the voting rights act, when it was OK to deny African Americans the right to vote. It was also OK to lynch them for voting. Time to stop splitting hairs in trump's do. Repeal and replace the 2016 election. Paper ballots, hand counted in all 50 states. Monitored by the League of Women Voters.

Move along. Nothing to see here. Hey, what about that wall, pretty cool huh? Or maybe, we still should lock her up shouldn't we? Or how about, look out for those Muslims, they'll get ya.

But all the denials and distractions still don't change the truth. The G men are coming for you orange man. And your friends too.

If Trump has nothing to hide he should be the biggest advocate for an independent investigation and should release his tax returns for at least as many years as he claims he has had no business ties to Russia.  Nothing could be more straightforward.  The fact that he continues stonewalling and whines of "witch hunts" and "illegal leaks" speaks volumes.  Remember Donny, your only paranoid if they are NOT out to get you.  Your paranoia seems well justified.

There are good reasons to international investigate conflicts of interests withing this or any administration. This should include business as well as the influence of foreign governments whether Russian, Saudi, Israeli or Chinese. As for the focus on Russia we are seeing, it is vital that we separate actual harmful conflicting connections and influence from overblown narratives pushed to promote pretexts for a National Security State coup with dangerous implications. Journalist Paul Street writes of the danger of blindly repeating convention narratives:

http://www.truthdig.com/report/item/the_deep_states_hatred_of_trump_is_n...

But the Republican David Nunes, head of the House Intelligence Committee, has already assured all of us that there's nothing there! No evidence of Trump-Russia ties!

Shouldn't that be enough for us?! End of discussion?! End of investigation?!

(Maybe he cleverly meant Trump Ties!)

LOL!

Sheer rubbish and if son has/had any dealings in Russia so what ?Russia is a major country encompassing 1/5 of Earth's land and despite some sanctions is part of the WTO. He has stated he has no deals in Russia with no loans either so where is the proof he does?. Here's what you should know that our government just like Russia spies and tries to influence other countries else you forgot how we hacked Merkel's and Bibi's personal cell phones and their our main allies. Where is the crime and what is the crime?.

Please, please have someone investigate James Comey!

We need an explanation of why he would break FBI rules and his own stated approach and sabotage Hillary Clinton's election at the last minute!

It's sad and ironic that the best investigative work in this newspaper seems to be in the Comments section. Don't look for the story of Dimitry Rybolevlov, bagman for Putin to Trump in the Main section.

Read it here on the Democracy Wall.
Follow the money ... find the mattress (tape).
Why wasn't Sergey thrown out by Obama?

Here we go here we go again. So the inference is that President Trump is actively working on behalf of Russia and Putin against the interests of the United States? Or that he worked with Russia to hack the Democratic Party and John Podesta's email to reveal the truth about their misbehaviors? By using a stupid phishing scheme that most intelligent people spot immediately?  Total FAKE NEWS!  It's sad to see the Democrats rip our country apart for purely partisan political purposes. Reminds me of the Florida fiasco when Al Gore and the democrats couldn't take losing fair and square and were totally willing to blow our country apart for nothing but selfish reasons. Sad.
Seems like these stories are showing how Trump's team  has been openly lying in front of Congress, but maybe I haven't read enough of Trump's tweets to get fully indoctrinated.

Either one is against the Constitution Kent-if you didn't know. Fake news are made up stories-this isn't, if you didn't know. Your acceptance of a enemy foreign power interfering in our election speaks volumes about you and rest of  "Trump followers" than it does about him. He has always been transparent to the many that knew him before all of this (presidency): gaudy, a bit of a slime-ball, but most importantly, power seeking. Your excuse and the many sheep that follow-SAD.

Trump, like Hillary Clinton, invites suspicion by refusing to be transparent and truthful and is paranoid.  He does not release his tax returns, denies everything, and defends the undefendable.  They are two peas in a pod.
Not even close.

No, not the same at all. We have seen the financial records pertaining to the Clintons multiple times. They are no longer in power, whereas Trump and his minions are. We need to see the financial records ASAP!

I know, right?! I mean suppose someone had found those three low-level classified emails with a (c) buried deep down in them!

So much more serious than an entire presidency corrupted by and beholden to a foreign power!

No.  This election which will prove to be a disaster for our beloved country lies at the feet of the feckless Republicans who gerrymandered their way into office  and who think they can control this beast.  They can't.
Traitors, all. Just vile specimens.

The Russia’s shadow has repeated, the Democrat transform to Sniper Party, however, their conspiracy couldn’t convince the US people and the world. Nowadays the real faces of Democrat, left media dropped the mask. Moreover, the president Donald Trump considers the left media carries the fake news and becomes the enemy of the people.
The Russia’s shadow is obsolete after the Democrat missed out the targets:
1-The Russia’s election involvement couldn’t overturn the election’s outcome and convince the people to believe the foreign helps Donald Trump. The Democrat underestimates the democratic level of the US people, they also snub the American, because the presidency to be decided by the US’s people, not Russia.
2-The Russia’s hacked Democrat National Convention that is baseless, they have not shown the evidence, but just the mouthful accusation.
The sniper tactic is going to expire, the Russia’s shadow is not the real, but they missed out the targets after shot to the shadow. Now the Democrat should be renamed THE SNIPER PARTY in the US.
Hoa Minh Truong.
(Author of 5 books, Vietnam veteran)

FACTS, not opinion: We live in a country controlled by one political party. We are at the mercy of that party to have any semblance of a system of checks and balance. And at the state level, Republicans now have 33 governors and control 32 legislatures. How can we have a full democracy like this? We do have a free press, but the president is intent on curtailing that freedom.

Why on earth was the Russian ambassador at the Republican convention?

Seriously.
Handing out the rubles.  Duh.

There should be nothing wrong with foreign dignitaries observing our political process and meeting with participants. However if meetings involve campaign staff or candidates it should be in an overt fashion with the full awareness of the public and press. We are supposed to have an open society.

" charming" won't cut it.  Next will be a Jimmy Swaggart style, tearful apology, without actually admitting anything wrong.  The family at his side. His " preacher" attesting to his character and deep love for God, and country.  You know, the standard script.    And Donald will just mumble platitudes, stage a few more campaign events and purge his staff, again.   All so predictable. We've seen this movie before.
True, we may have seen this movie before but it is turning into a political play called 'No Exit'.

Ms. Collins,

Nancy Pelosi denied meeting with Ambassador Kislyak yet there she is seen in a photograph sitting directly across from him. I would say that is quite embarrassing and how does she explain that omission. Was she having a senior moment? I think she should be investigated for lying as there is direct proof that a meeting did take place. Don't you think it is only fair that this should be investigated also. It does not look good for her when she is so critical of the behavior of Jeff Sessions when she did the exact same thing. Fairness anyone?
Schumer and Pelosi were pictured meeting with Russian officials in public during the course of official business. They were in plain sight of the Press and public. Hence, the pictures.

It was not THE EXACT SAME THING.  This is a photo from a public meeting with many other people taken ten years ago.  She wasn't "meeting" with the ambassador privately.  Chances are Pelosi meets with groups of people often, and it is very likely she did not recall this particular day ten years ago.  It is quite a different situation when Sessions said under oath that he had not met with the Russians when in fact he had met privately with the ambassador very recently.  These are not equivalent events.  Think of it this way--your spouse attends a meeting with a group of people in a public area ten years ago or your spouse meets a person privately in a hotel a month ago.  Are these equivalent?  Not the exact same thing.

Fairness anyone?  Sitting at a whole table of both Democrats and Republicans together with Russian diplomats is not the same as a one-on-one meetings that you deny having.  I would imagine that almost every Senator has met in public with all kinds of foreign ambassadors.  So she didn't "meet" with him in the same way that Sessions did, and that was all she was saying.  So yes, a little fairness would be nice.

imagine if all the republicans were democrats can you just imagine the howling, gnashing of republican teeth and screeches for investigations that would be screamed from every right-winging cretin on as many news broadcasts as possible. It would be far worse than the years of the Benghazi debacle. But now we're in trump world and they can talk to an enemy of our beloved country and we're supposed to shut up. We're supposed to let the trumpskies do whatever they want with who ever they want. Because they own our country and they can sell it to the highest bidder.…unless the real democrats and citizens demand otherwise. We can only lose our country, our freedoms and our way of life if we let these cretins get away with it. Flynn's gone and sessions needs to go as well until they're all gone and we get our country back!

Russia, Russia Russia.  We've been hearing from the administration that all the Russian meetings with Trump campaigners were perfectly innocent and routine. So routine they forgot about them... even under oath.  What is it with the Russia and the Russian Ambassador...just coincidence?   Speaking of routine was the Belgian Ambassador or the Ambassador from Iceland invited to Trump Tower for a meeting to get to know them?  The dots seem to be connecting themselves.

The answer....C.  How the republicans can continue to turn their backs on this issue and deny the facts is beyond the pale.  Jeff Sessions needs to resign, even if his boss still approves of him, which is not to say that he won't throw him under the bus, especially when he, trump, has to now deal with his  son-in-law's meeting with the Russian's.   Guess who he'll cover for and protect.
they are skunks and just doing what comes naturally
There are plenty of good people in Congress, to be honest. They're mostly the ones you never hear about.
